text:
FYI in the documentation overview page, the type for datetime is date*T*ime with capital T, while in the property type list under the endpoints, it's without capital letter. To do the call, it needs to be without, just thought I'd point it out here.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties>
I'm no expert but I like your approach.  I say if it works then you're probably good to go.

hello is there a way to submit to a form created in HubSpot using the `HubSpot/api-client` for node? I see functions to create/modify a form but not an api to actually use it. I cannot use the form embed directly from the browser and would like to submit from servers.

My understanding is that contact CRM card can have custom actions embeded in them.
If so, is there a way to trigger all the custom actions for a list of contact?

In the v4 association schema API, we can pass a `name` for the association label, but I don't quite understand how to use it; when you read back the association config, you just get a `typeId` and `label`; there seems to be no way to get that `name` back again, which makes it mighty hard to properly automate schema management of association labels. Am I missing an API endpoint that returns `name`?
